description: Sven Halek secretly transmits Council-level override credentials to selected leaders among the 'invisibles', enabling them to access and coordinate city infrastructure without immediate detection.
Key services in several districts stabilize unexpectedly. Residents begin circulating rumors that the 'invisibles' are responsible for restoring order where BCI assignments had failed.

An anonymous public message appears on city networks: reintegrate disappeared citizens and reform the Council, or infrastructure will be methodically delayed in protest. The message emphasizes nonviolent, organized reform.

'Invisibles' continue to coordinate essential services and gain support as public commutes and resource distribution fluctuate. White banners signaling approval of the re-emerged citizens appear, while Council supporters push back.

Mass demonstrations unite previously vanished citizens and their supporters, demanding restoration of rights and direct Council negotiations as the city nears a crossroads between reform and prolonged disruption.
